problem.markdown:
>>Consider a universe of 2-petal flowers in which a 2-petal flower can have none, one, or both petals colored blue (B) with the rest of the petals red (R). The probability that a flower in that subset has both petals colored blue is one half.
Which of the following are correct:
<<
[ ]Let U = {B,R} and w = B if the petals are blue, w = R if the petals are red, P(X(w = BBB) = 3) = 0.5 [x]Let U = {BB, BR, RB, RR} and w = BB if all petals are blue, w = RR if all petals are red, and BR, or RB if there is one of each. Let X E V be the number of blue petals, where V is the integer line. P(w = BB)=P(X=2) = 0.5. [ ]Let V = {BB, BR, RB, RR} and w = BB if all petals are blue, w = RR if all petals are red, and BR, or RB if there is one of each. Let X E V be the number of red petals, where V is the real number line. P(x(w = BB) = 0) = 0.5. [x]Let U = {BB, BR, RB, RR} and w = BB if all petals are blue, w = RR if all petals are red, and BR, or RB if there is one of each. Let X E V be the number of red petals, where V is the real number line. P(X = 0) = 0.5.

Consider a universe of 2-petal flowers in which a 2-petal flower can have none, one, or both petals colored blue (B) with the rest of the petals red (R). The probability that a flower in that subset has both petals colored blue is one half.
Which of the following are correct:

checkboxgroup.choice: Let U = {B,R} and w = B if the petals are blue, w = R if the petals are red, P(X(w = BBB) = 3) = 0.5

Let U = {BB, BR, RB, RR} and w = BB if all petals are blue, w = RR if all petals are red, and BR, or RB if there is one of each. Let X E V be the number of blue petals, where V is the integer line. P(w = BB)=P(X=2) = 0.5.

Let V = {BB, BR, RB, RR} and w = BB if all petals are blue, w = RR if all petals are red, and BR, or RB if there is one of each. Let X E V be the number of red petals, where V is the real number line. P(x(w = BB) = 0) = 0.5.

Let U = {BB, BR, RB, RR} and w = BB if all petals are blue, w = RR if all petals are red, and BR, or RB if there is one of each. Let X E V be the number of red petals, where V is the real number line. P(X = 0) = 0.5.

div.p: U represents the universe of all possibilities. The capital X represents a random variable and is not to be confused with the lower-case x which denotes a specific possible value of X.
